title: 109_hr4447
content: The "Medicaid Indian Health Act of 2005" allows for the application of 100 percent FMAP for services provided to an Indian through an urban Indian health program. Additionally, the Act prohibits the imposition of premiums, deductibles, copayments, and other cost-sharing on Indians. Section 1916 of the Social Security Act is amended to include provisions for Indians defined in the Indian Health Care Improvement Act. Additionally, a prohibition on recovery against estates of Indians is established. "Prohibition on recovery against estates of Indians is established. Consultation with Indian tribes required prior to approval of Section 1115 waivers." Section 1115 of the Social Security Act is amended to require consultation with Indian tribes before granting waivers affecting them. Additionally, there is a requirement for fair payment by Medicaid managed care entities to Indian health program providers. Section 1903(m)(2)(A)(ii) of the Social Security Act is amended to require payment provision for entities contracting with Indian Health Service facilities or programs. The Social Security Act is amended to require entities contracting with Indian Health Service facilities to provide payment at the highest level they would pay to non-IHS providers. SEC. 7 amends the Social Security Act to include medical expenses paid by Indian Health Programs as costs for determining medically needy eligibility. SEC. 8 allows states to exempt Indians from reductions in eligibility or benefits. Section 1902 of the Social Security Act is amended to prevent the Secretary from disapproving State plan amendments or waivers that would exempt Indians eligible for medical assistance from certain restrictions or cost-sharing requirements. The Act and its amendments apply to items or services provided after January 1, 2006, with an extension for State plans needing legislative changes to comply with the new requirements. In the case of a State with a 2-year legislative session, each year is considered a separate regular session of the State legislature.
